title: Fix error when default_collate is passed a collection of numpy.str_
body_html:
Fixes #2914.

There was a bug that when a numpy array containing strings was passed to default_collate, a key error would occur because the code assumes numpy arrays contain numeric types.

Test Plan

Make sure the following doesn't error out:

import torch
import numpy as np
from torch.utils.data.dataloader import default_collate

x = np.array(["foo", "bar"])
default_collate(x)
body_text:
Fixes #2914.
There was a bug that when a numpy array containing strings was passed to default_collate, a key error would occur because the code assumes numpy arrays contain numeric types.
Test Plan
Make sure the following doesn't error out:

x = np.array(["foo", "bar"])
default_collate(x)
body:
Fixes #2914.

There was a bug that when a numpy array containing strings was passed to `default_collate`, a key error would occur because the code assumes numpy arrays contain numeric types.

### Test Plan
Make sure the following doesn't error out:
```
import torch
import numpy as np
from torch.utils.data.dataloader import default_collate

x = np.array(["foo", "bar"])
default_collate(x)
```
